intro: Sobralia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sobralia, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in the understory of forests. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are usually pale yellow to orange in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Sobralia parviflora is valued in horticulture for its unique floral display and ability to thrive in humid, shaded conditions.
